column5: Content

column3: 1-4-1 Double Mumbo to Weave Set Play
column5: The lacrosse strategy involves executing the 141 double Mumbo that everyone loves but adds a weave motion over the top, using coordinated picks and player movements to disorient the defense and create multiple scoring opportunities. This approach emphasizes teamwork, timing, and precise execution to exploit defensive weaknesses and generate advantageous situations for attackers.
We discuss the reasons why the 1-4-1 Offense is a great option to attack a zone defense with.

This lacrosse strategy involves a dynamic 141 offense derived from the traditional 2112 motion offense, focusing on player movement, positioning, and coordinated dodging to create scoring opportunities. It emphasizes a push-pull motion for ball handlers, strategic positioning for off-ball players, and quick adaptation to defensive actions to maintain offensive advantage and exploit weaknesses.
1-4-1 Wing Pairs Offense. The first of 3 parts of the Penn State Offense
How to implement the 10 Man Ride used by Virginia, Bucknell, UNC, Loyola, Boston, Michigan, and More!

This simple and adaptable Man Up Motion is used to create shooting opportunities by attacking the gaps of zone defense or making a man to man defense rotate further than expected. It also focuses on allowing players to play and make reads, rather than running set plays every time.
This play is designed to give your best shooters a step-down shot from 8-10 yards.
Offensive Set Play from the 1-4-1 Set.

column3: 1v1 Ground Balls to Give and Go
column5: The 1v1 Ground Ball to Give and Go drill focuses on enhancing players’ground ball skills, dodging abilities, and defensive techniques in a competitive setting. It is a great drill to incorporate for pregame warm ups.
The 2-Ball Reaction Drill is an excellent drill for training change of direction footwork, first-time ground balls, and outlet passes!
This is an in-depth hour and 50 minute video going over all of the ways to execute and defend two men games. It is the large video that all of the others break into components with.
2 Man Games are all about decision making. In this video we discuss the decision making options from a ball carrier perspective.
2 Man Games are all about decision making. In this video, we discuss the decision making options from an off-ball player perspective.
An overview of how the location of picks can change the way picks work.
An overview of how we want players to set the Perfect Pick.
A look into defending when you are down 2 Men.
The 2-3-2 clear is the new standard clear in college lacrosse because of it’s innovative subbing pattern and incredible ability to spread the field to beat even the toughest rides!
Explainer video about a modification to the original 21-12 Motion Offense video

21-12 is an offensive concept that combines 4 widely used traditional offensive sets (2-2-2, 2-3-1, 1-3-2, and Open) into a single concept that is easy for players to understand and allows coaches to train and modify quickly with small sided 3 Man games and motions.
Shortened version of the 21-12 Motion Offense - This has the correct ideas, but is short and not explanatory enough.
Quick passing + off-ball seal + timed cut = Lots of goals.
Penn State’s 3 High Pairs Offense

column3: 3 Man Gears Offense vs Zone Defense
column5: The 3 Man Gears Zone Offense is a great option vs a zone. It creates ton of motion for a team that can make great decisions.

3 Man Passing is a great stickwork drill to use during transition-focused practices because it gets the players moving up and down the field, teaches elements of clearing communication, and adds in a bit of hidden conditioning in.
These simple 4 Man Wheels Motions put every Man Down Defense in difficult situations that are easy to read and exploit.
Simple and effective. That’s what Man Up is all about. This simple Man Up Set will allow your players to make reads on the field and execute with the man advantage.
Simple and Effective. This man up play exposes the man down defensive strategy and allows your trigger man to read the field and make a variety of passes to open players.
How to use 3v0, 3v2, and 3v3 Drills to build your offense
Get all your players to play both sides of the ball with this simple modification to 3v2’s and 4v3’s.

Offenses with a dangerous inside finisher can be deadly…Especially man down. The 4 Man Rotation is a Man Down Defensive Strategy that locks off a single player inside and allows the remaining 4 defenseman to rotate to the remaining 5 offensive players.
This video describes the foreman rotation man down defense
This is a video about the 43 Alpha clear, the most utilized clear in Lacrosse
This video describes the 43 clear which is characterized by four players across the midline and three players building the base of the clear with the defenseman goalie and defense

column3: 5 Keys to Picking and Building Lacrosse Drills
column5: Learning how to pick the drills you want

The 5 Man Rotation is a true Man to Man Defense minus the penalized player. The deficit of the penalized player puts the defense in a constant state of recovery, but the priority of getting to the hands of the ball carrier and adjacents is emphasized.
The 5 Man Rotation is the base man to man MDD.
5 on a Die Drill breaks down the assignments and roles of any man to man defense allowing players to get a greater understanding of slide and recovery principles.
Keep away drills are a fun and fast-paced way to warm players up while maintaining their read and react principles.
Another great box play/concept to use in your 7v7 and 10v10 offenses.
Keep things simple in your 7v7 Tournaments with the 4v4 Y-Offense.

column3: A Complete Guide To Man Down Defense
column5: A complete guide to man down defense! This is everything I know about man down defense!
An introduction to the concepts of man to man defense and the basic philosophy of an adjacent slide defense.

column5: This is one of the ways to beat zone defense

column3: Basics of Individual Defensive Play in Lacrosse
column5: Individual Defensive Play and Basics in Lacrosse! An overview of individual defensive play and basics in lacrosse. A video addition to “The Player and Parents Guide to Lacrosse”by Patrick Chapla.

column5: This is a video about the benefits of dodging and beating your man when playing against a zone defense

column5: Many Drills for Gym Practices
Explainer video of Big Little Pick Concept within 2 Man Games
Bling Bling Shooting is a simple dodging and shooting drill that you can use to train a large group of players a plethora of shooting and dodging tactics.

column3: Box and 1 Zone Man Down Defense
column5: The Box and 1 is an extremely popular introductory man down defense to start teams off with.

column3: Box and Suprise Lock Man Down Defense
column5: This is one of my new favorite Man Down Defenses. Show your base MDD and then lock with the shorty and play 5v4 with 4 poles!
Transition accounts for over 70% of goals! This post will cover everything you need to know to score more and get scored on less!

column3: Box Man Up Play - Double Picks
column5: These Box Lacrosse Man Up Plays are simple and effective. By setting two picks on a single side of the floor, we take a 3v2 advantage and turn it into a 1v0.
Continue building box picking concepts with 3v0 –3v2 –3v3 Drills. Using the 3v series, we will integrate both sides of the floor and begin to integrate backside defensive play.
Pass Down Pick Downs with a Cycle backside create a dynamic offensive flow! Learn how to build this series with 4v0’s, 4v3’s, and 4v4’s!

column3: Building Offense and Defense with 3v0's, 3v2's, and 3v3's
column5: The part whole method at work. This video walks through the intricacies of teaching offense and defense from the bottom up!
A tutorial about how I create the play diagrams that I use in my playbook PDFs.
Up Picks with a Cycle backside creates an effective offensive flow and allows players to slip top down towards the goal! Learn how to build this series with 4v0’s, 4v3’s, and 4v4’s!
1v1 Ground Ball Drill

column3: Cheddar and Pepper Jack Man Up Plays OFfense
column5: Early in the 2022 Season, one of our Captains brought me a Man Up Play called Cheddar that he had been using in the Summer Club Season. We renamed and installed it during our first couple weeks, and went into our first game against Corner Canyon and got destroyed by their Pressure 5 Man Rotation. The problem was not the play exactly, it was that the play hinged on 2 or 3 passes for a specific look that we failed make with the pressure.

Choosing the correct stick is the most important decision a parent can make when their young player tries lacrosse! Huge thank you to Alf Jacques, Greg Kenneally, and Jake Smith for being in the video as well as String King, East Coast Dyes, and Powell Lacrosse for sending me their sticks.

Having great stick skills means more than just being able to pass, catch, and pick up ground balls. It means being able to wield your stick and control the ball like an experienced samurai controls his katana. Give every player on your team a ton of great reps with this simple and effective skill drill.
Communication is essential during a clear, use this terminology to clear efficiently!

Teach your players everything they need to know about clearing by using this drill. It will help train the motions and concepts of your clear while training the skills necessary to clear successfully.
A Coaches perspective on the relationship between coaches and refs in lacrosse and what we can do from both sides to improve the game.
This is a set play that worked really well for us at Grandview. Out of the 231 set.
An introduction to the concepts of man to man defense and the basic philosophy of a crease slide defense.
An overview of the Cuse Motion Offense!

column3: Cuse Motion Offense vs Zone Defense
column5: We show how the Cuse Motion Offense can be used to attack Zone Defense.
How to defend a plethora of 2 Man Games.
This video outlines the best ways to defend getting hung up at X.
Learn this beautifully designed endline play that helped the University of Denver win the 2015 National Championship.
This “Triangle Offense based”3 man motion can be run from the midfield or attack and will put a ton of stress on the opposing defense. This motion can be used as a part of the 21-12 offense.
21-12 Motion Offense Concept
These are my favorite dodges for Attackmen.  An overview of 3 popular Attack Dodges in Lacrosse.

These are my favorite movements and dodges for defensemen in lacrosse. An overview of popular dodges and movements for defenseman in Lacrosse. A video addition to “The Player and Parents Guide to Lacrosse”by Patrick Chapla. Patrick Chapla.
These are my favorite dodges for Midfielders.  An overview of popular Midfield Dodges in Lacrosse.
Picks are a great time to surprise a team and double the ball. In this video, we discuss the methods for doubling the ball.
This fast-paced, transition-oriented, competition drill will kick your practice into high gear! It’s a definitive player favorite.

Whether used as an endline play or part of your offensive motion, the Duke Motion is a great way to draw slides and set up dodges on recovering defensemen.
This player favorite will develop your teams transition offense, ground balls, and clearing! All in one drill!

column3: Duke’s Fade and Follow Offense vs Zone Defense
column5: This is an exploration of the Duke fade and follow offense, and it's usefulness against his own
Duke’s Hybrid Man Down which combines a 5 Man Rotation on passes and switches to a zone on carries.

This is a video about East West Dodge, which are Dodge where the Player is moving around the perimeter of the field and then change his direction or pace to try to make the defender be on the side of them to allow them to get from the perimeter to the center of the field, where they can shoot.
Face offs can win and lose games, so you’d better have a plan. By using this simple strategy, your team will have an advantage at the X.

The Full Field Build Up Drill is foundational in teaching the situational awareness on the offensive and defensive side of the ball. It is extremely fun, incorporates the entire team, and can be a very intense conditioning drill for midfielders who begin the drill early.
General Drill is a recovery 1v1 drill at the edge of dangerous space that forces players to embrace contact to be successful! Modified from UVA Coach Lars Tiffany’s presentation at IMLCA.
What are Hands Free Dodges in Lacrosse? An overview of 3 popular Hands Free Dodges in Lacrosse. A video addition to “The Player and Parents Guide to Lacrosse”by Patrick Chapla.

Head Man Passing is an essential stick work drill for any box team. It emphasizes getting the ball up the floor, catching over the shoulder passes, communicating, and allows players to work on finishing 1v1 on the goalie.

column3: Hopkins 3-3 Wheel and Seal Man Up Play
column5: Hopkins uses a 3-3 4 Man Side Wheel to set up a double seal for the freshman phenom Joey Epstein.
Virginia’s House Zone killed it in the 2019 NCAA Tournament. We overview the strategy!
This is an in-depth video about how to beat zone defenses and it includes all of the other videos referencing offense against zone defense.
Patrick teaches the proper technique of how to catch in lacrosse and gives drills that you can do at home.
Patrick teaches cradling techniques and drills that you can do at home!

column5: An overview of Step Back Throw Back technique and drills to work on at home!

column5: Learn to execute Hidden Ball Tricks like a PRO!

column5: In this video, Patrick teaches how to hold the stick and give some drills to help players activate their fingers to allow them to control the ball in the stick better

column5: Patrick teaches the proper technique of how to pick up ground balls and gives three drills you can use to practice at home

column5: Patrick teaches the proper technique of how to use question mark hands free dodges and goes over drills for you to do at home.
Patrick teaches technique and drills for how to shoot in tight, with time and room, and on the run!

column5: Patrick teaches techniques of shooting in tight and drills you can use to practice at home.

column5: Patrick teaches how to shoot on the run and drills you can do to perfect your technique at home.

column3: How to Throw Fakes in Lacrosse
column5: Patrick teaches faking techniques and how to practice them at home!

This innovative lacrosse drill focuses on enhancing player skills through high-quality, game-like repetitions, ideal for teams with new or young players. Coaches will find it valuable for its emphasis on essential techniques like V-cuts and ground ball pickups, ensuring players develop technical skills and game sense efficiently.
Learn how to teach your players box picking with 2v0’s 2v1’s and 2v2’s

Getting to the Island is an offensive players dream and a defensive players nightmare. This drill focuses on exactly what both sides of the ball should be doing from this important position on the field.
Coach Berkman talks through 10 things to you can do to during the recruiting process.

column3: Jumping The Ball Man Down Defense
column5: Surprise your opponent by setting a specific player to anticipate and apply heavy pressure on your man down set!
Tried and True…The “L”Fast Break is simple and effective.
This is an overview of all of the Goalie play techniques. It also includes a ton of concepts for goalies.

<style type="text/css"><!--td {border: 1px solid #ccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}--></style>An overview of the Fade and Follow Offense that Duke used to put up 19 vs Hopkins in the first round last year.
Modify your line drills to get the most out of your practice time!
The Mammoth Shooting Drill teaches players how to substitute while getting a ton of breakaway shooting reps!
An overview of strategies when clearing while man down.
A look at the strategy behind facing off man down.
Easily get out of doubles and clear the ball during restarts while man down using these simple steps!
These are my favorite dodges for Attackmen.  An overview of 3 popular Attack Dodges in Lacrosse.

This man to man defensive strategy combines the strategies of crease and adjacent slide packages in order to create a sliding system that is easier to teach and more instinctive for players on the field.
An overview of North-South Dodges.
An evaluation of the footwork used in North-South Dodges to change directions and speeds to gain separation!
An overview of the Ohio State Pairs Offense that destroyed Denver in 2017!

column3: Ohio State Pairs Offense in 5 Minutes
column5: This is a video of the Ohio State pears offense in very quick fashion.

Partner Passing Drill is one of the best drills to teach players form, work on new techniques, and warm up to begin practice. Partner Passing is one of my favorite drills because it:
1) gives players a ton of reps to warm them up at the beginning of practice.
2) puts tremendous emphasis on technique.
3) integrates dodging.
4) is a great drill to teach players new and advanced techniques.

Led by, 2019 Tewaaraton Award Finalist and record setting distributor Grant Ament (1) and sniper Mac O’Keefe (3), Penn State scored 17.94 goals per game and had the #1 offense in 2019. Although the performance of Ament and O’Keefe drew the headlines, neither would have achieved nearly as much without the exceptional play of: Dylan Foulds (14), Nick Spillane (13), Jack Kelly (25), TJ Malone (7), and a few others. Anytime the defense gave Ament or O’Keefe too much room they would get burned. When the defense adjusted to help cover Ament or O’Keefe the others would capitalize. The six players were like piranhas, combining to be nearly unstoppable.
This video explores the benefits of using picks when the defense is playing in a zone.
Penn States Picks Behind Offense

The Power 1 Midfield Play is a set play that uses a misdirection pick or a double pick to produce a step down shot from 8-10 yards by creating a skip lane or a shot on the run with a sweep by picking the switch.
Corner Canyon killed us by applying pressure on Man Down. We liked it so much that we took it!

column3: Reading Man Down Defense in a 3-3
column5: This is an in-depth exploration of how to read the man down defense when your team is in a 3-3 formation on man up.
A look at the stressful lacrosse recruiting landscape, misconceptions that create a ton of anxiety for ambitious high school players, and a few ways to reorient our perspective.

The Regular Midfield Motion is a 21-12 Motion that reflects the Triangle Offense Concept. It is made up of the “Dodge-Follow-Float”and “Sweep-Fade-Float”motions that reflect the decision of the dodger when they sweep across the top or dodge down the alley.

After falling to a 7-2 deficit in the 2nd quarter, The Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT) used a House and 1 Zone to switch up the tempo and ultimately with the 2022 DIII National Championship against Union. This video and PDF will overview the zone they used.
Running the box is a thankless task, but when it’s done properly is as fluid as the game itself. Learn how to integrate substitution into your complete game plan.

column3: Rutgers 3-3 Flip and Swing Man Up Plays
column5: The Rutgers Flip and Swing Man Up Plays were used to score two goals in their win over Ohio State in 2019. The plays used a flip, quick ball movement, and off ball motion to exploit Ohio State’s 5 Man Rotation.
This simple and effective motion incorporates a dodge, ball reversal, and draft cut to help you score goals in those all important moments!
Get every player on your team involved and teach them fundamental skills like passing, catching, coming off picks, fakes, and east-west dodges with this new school stick skill drill.

The Salisbury Call Drill is a fast-paced slide and recovery drill that teaches sliding, recovering, bumping, and playing the two inside. Offensively, it focuses on stepping away to accept slides in order to move the ball.

column3: Salisbury Low Shallow Cut Offense vs Zone Defense
column5: Salisbury used an open set with low shallow cuts to draw the zone out of position and cut behind ball watching players!
Salmon Bellies is a simple shooting drill that emphasizes slipping after picking off ball!

column3: Seawolves Drill Off Ball offense and Defense Mens and Womens Lacrosse
column5: The Seawolves drill is a high-level off-ball offensive and defensive drill that revolutionized how our players played off-ball this year. I believe that it is one of the main factors that propelled us to our first-ever playoff win because it forces players into game-like off-ball finishing situations.
Short 1v1’s increases the emphasis on what offensive and defensive players should do when a dodge gets near the middle of the field.
This is a video about utilizing the three on twos on the sides of the field when playing against a zone defense. So it's a concept for beating zone defenses, it can be a strategy in and of itself.
Sideways West Genny is a fast-paced competition drill that focuses on offensive and defensive players reading the field and making good decisions.

<style type="text/css"><!--td {border: 1px solid #ccc;}br {mso-data-placement:same-cell;}--></style>If you don’t shoot, you can’t score. But why not run a shooting drill that reinforces the motions and concepts of your offense? Skeleton shooting is a tremendous drill for training players to shoot within the concepts of the offense that you run!
The best time to attack a defense is before it get set up. This slow break sets up your offense fluidly while can pushing the tempo during the first 10 seconds of a possession.
The Spike Stickwork &Passing Drill Drill is an excellent warm up drill that emphasizes swinging the ball around the perimeter of the field while integrating variety of techniques.
Challenge your players by combining two separate drills into one exceptional drill while focusing on passing and catching on the run inside as well as exchanging the ball on the outside.
An in-depth look into how to set up and run the classic Star Passing Drill and an innovative way to challenge players by adding in a wrinkle.
This gives you a huge advantage if you can keep your opponents offense of personnel on the field!
21-12 Motion Offense Concept
Teaching players the correct way to exchange the ball is imperative to setting up and running any offense. This drill will allow you to get reps at all types of skills and exchanges.
Educational video explaining technical fouls.
How do we want our players to ride within the 3-3 Deep Zone Ride, 2 Down Windshield Wiper Ride, Goalie Ride, and Zero Ride.

Players who don’t step away to free their hands end up turning the ball over. So, train them how to use north-south dodges, east-west dodges, and hands-free dodges with this simple and effective skill drill.
This is a gauntlet style drill that will truly test how your defenseman approach when they’re tired.
Transition opportunities come in all shapes and sizes. This 5v4 break can be tough for players to recognize, but once they see the advantage, it’s hard to stop.
The triangle approach drill is a simple drill that shows defenseman how to direct a dodger.

The Triangle Show Drill teaches players how an adjacent slide package works by simulating adjacent slides and recoveries in a 3v3 set. The players will learn:
1) Communication for on-ball and adjacent players.
2) Off ball stance and positioning.
3) Adjacent slide and recovery mechanics and communication for simple dodges, carry shallow cuts, and picks.
Use substitutions to free up a midfielder on a man down dead ball clear.
An overview of all the different types of 2 Man Games
This Slow Break Offense will allow you to get your offensive personnel on the field while creating strong hand feed and finish looks!

column3: Up Pick to Down Pick Box Offense
column5: This simple offense combines 4 separate picks to run consistently and consecutively. It frustrates defenses by making them make decisions constantly and allows players to play fast within a structured offense that has a plethora of looks and playmaking opportunities.
Learn the ins and outs of setting and defending picks in Box Lacrosse.
A staple in Virginia’s 2019 National Championship run! This is the play they used to beat Maryland and Duke in OT and used it to score 5 times in the National Championship against Yale!
Players version of Virginia's 2-2-2 From X

column3: Virginia's Man Up Motions into a 3-3
column5: Virginia’s Man Up Offense is an excellent example of how using simple motions to put playmakers in the right positions can be all you need.
The Weave and Mumbo Box Lacrosse Offense is a simple motion offense based on the Duke Fade and Follow Offense. It’s easy for players to remember and creates a ton of great shooting opportunities!
Learn the ins and outs of Wesleyan’s 2018 National Championship 3-3 Zone Defense!

A detailed description of this “player favorite”competition drill that focuses on transition offensive and defensive concepts and can be modified to work on offensive motions and defensive slide packages.

This video explains what north south Dodgers are, essentially these are Dodgers that begin on the perimeter of the field, where the dodger runs at the defenseman. So north is the perimeter of the field, south is the Crea area in front of the Goal.

I feel that the game is more than the rules and regulations. I tried to convey the soul of our game in all of its forms and honor it’s traditions while emphasizing that everyone can utilize their unique gifts. The game sells itself, but perhaps this will entice a few more families into joining our community.
Wheel Rotations can be used to draw players in zones out of position so that we can create great offensive chances.
The Wild Cat Trap Zone Defense takes the traditional 3-3 Zone formation but flips the principles on their heads.

Wind Ups are the triple threat position in lacrosse. The ball carrier can dodge, pass, or shoot. It’s also extremely intimidating to defenders who don’t want to get hit with a shot. This drill focuses on teaching offensive players how to use wind ups to manipulate defenders and defenders how to stay poised and focused on playing proper defense.

What are wind up dodges in lacrosse? An overview of popular wind up dodges in lacrosse.  Wind up Dodgers are Dodgers where the player will wind up like they're going to shoot and then dodge when the defender flinches.

column3: Womens Lacrosse : How to Cradle, Switch Hands, and Catch
column5: Understanding how to cradle, switch hand, and catch with a womens stick vs a mens stick will allow for womens players to utilize all of the mens lacrosse skill content.

column3: Womens Sticks: All the Skills Transfer
column5: New technology has created women’s lacrosse sticks with nearly the same control as men’s sticks. Girls looking to play box lacrosse or pickup lacrosse with the boys should know that the skills they build will transfer to the new sticks.

Wristers are an essential drill to use in the box! Box Lacrosse is a much faster game with a lot less space. Wristers teach players how to snap off passes or shots in tight spaces without moving their hands away from their body. Wristers also incorporate learning how to use fakes.

This multi-purpose competition drill can be used to help your offense bridge the gap from smaller 3 motions and drills into a full 6v6 concept and teach defensive players the perfect off-ball positioning and show and slide techniques when a dodge is coming from X.

column3: Yale Bulldog Set Play vs Zone Defense
column5: Yale ran this play vs Loyola’s Zone Defense

column3: You're Ruining Reps with Greasy Balls! The POWLAX Greaser Expirament
column5: All those old balls are ruining reps in practice. Get rid of them and upgrade to ECD Mint or Pearl X’s.
